<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 123, 645, 149]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge International AS & A Level  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 171, 195, 202]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 221, 170, 250]]<|/det|>
CENTRE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 214, 428, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[621, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 214, 907, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 277, 235, 293]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 908, 293]]<|/det|>
9709/42  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 303, 243, 318]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Mechanics  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 303, 908, 319]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 908, 344]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 450, 763, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 466, 809, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 482, 566, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 498, 487, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 528, 870, 558]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 558, 487, 573]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 573, 883, 602]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 603, 858, 633]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 633, 784, 649]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity \((g)\) is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 681, 216, 696]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 697, 388, 712]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 712, 732, 728]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
A block of mass \(15\mathrm{kg}\) slides down a line of greatest slope of an inclined plane. The top of the plane is at a vertical height of \(1.6\mathrm{m}\) above the level of the bottom of the plane. The speed of the block at the top of the plane is \(2\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{-1}\) and the speed of the block at the bottom of the plane is \(4\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 636, 156]]<|/det|>
Find the work done against the resistance to motion of the block.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 136, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[379, 82, 655, 308]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 325, 920, 392]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a smooth ring \(R\), of mass \(m \mathrm{kg}\), threaded on a light inextensible string. A horizontal force of magnitude \(2 \mathrm{N}\) acts on \(R\). The ends of the string are attached to fixed points \(A\) and \(B\) on a vertical wall. The part \(AR\) of the string makes an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) with the vertical, the part \(BR\) makes an angle of \(40^{\circ}\) with the vertical and the string is taut. The ring is in equilibrium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 403, 541, 422]]<|/det|>
Find the tension in the string and find the value of \(m\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 404, 920, 422]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[344, 87, 690, 266]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 289, 920, 355]]<|/det|>
A block of mass \(10\mathrm{kg}\) is at rest on a rough plane inclined at an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) to the horizontal. A force of \(120\mathrm{N}\) is applied to the block at an angle of \(20^{\circ}\) above a line of greatest slope (see diagram). There is a force resisting the motion of the block and \(200\mathrm{J}\) of work is done against this force when the block has moved a distance of \(5\mathrm{m}\) up the plane from rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 368, 811, 386]]<|/det|>
Find the speed of the block when it has moved a distance of \(5\mathrm{m}\) up the plane from rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 368, 920, 386]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.2\mathrm{kg}\) lies at rest on a rough horizontal plane. A horizontal force of \(1.2\mathrm{N}\) is applied to \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 120, 910, 139]]<|/det|>
Given that \(P\) is in limiting equilibrium, find the coefficient of friction between \(P\) and the plane.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 136, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 160, 920, 180]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 198, 920, 217]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 235, 920, 253]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 272, 920, 290]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 308, 920, 327]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 345, 920, 363]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 443, 148, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 443, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
Given instead that the coefficient of friction between \(P\) and the plane is 0.3, find the distance travelled by \(P\) in the third second of its motion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 460, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 495, 920, 514]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 532, 920, 551]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 570, 920, 588]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 643, 920, 661]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<form>......

<form>......

<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 788, 920, 806]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 825, 920, 842]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 860, 920, 878]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 896, 920, 914]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
A particle \(A\) of mass \(0.5 \mathrm{kg}\) is projected vertically upwards from horizontal ground with speed \(25 \mathrm{m s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 103, 722, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the speed of \(A\) when it reaches a height of \(20 \text{m}\) above the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 475, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
When \(A\) reaches a height of \(20\mathrm{m}\), it collides with a particle \(B\) of mass \(0.3\mathrm{kg}\) which is moving downwards in the same vertical line as \(A\) with speed \(32.5\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\). In the collision between the two particles, \(B\) is brought to instantaneous rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 540, 146, 559]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 540, 816, 559]]<|/det|>
Show that the velocity of \(A\) immediately after the collision is \(4.5 \mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) downwards.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 540, 920, 559]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 74, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Find the time interval between \(A\) and \(B\) reaching the ground. You should assume that \(A\) does not bounce when it reaches the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
A railway engine of mass \(120000\mathrm{kg}\) is towing a coach of mass \(60 000\mathrm{kg}\) up a straight track inclined at an angle of \(\alpha\) to the horizontal where \(\sin \alpha = 0.02\). There is a light rigid coupling, parallel to the track, connecting the engine and coach. The driving force produced by the engine is \(125 000\mathrm{N}\) and there are constant resistances to motion of \(22 000\mathrm{N}\) on the engine and \(13 000\mathrm{N}\) on the coach.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 152, 146, 170]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 151, 725, 170]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration of the engine and find the tension in the coupling.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 151, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
At an instant when the engine is travelling at \(30 \text{m s}^{-1}\) , it comes to a section of track inclined upwards at an angle \(\beta\) to the horizontal. The power produced by the engine is now \(4 500 000 \text{W}\) and, as a result, the engine maintains a constant speed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 148, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 135, 752, 153]]<|/det|>
Assuming that the resistance forces remain unchanged, find the value of \(\beta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
A particle \(X\) travels in a straight line. The velocity of \(X\) at time \(t\) s after leaving a fixed point \(O\) is denoted by \(\nu \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[383, 109, 615, 131]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = -0.1t^{3} + 1.8t^{2} - 6t + 5.6.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 135, 601, 154]]<|/det|>
The acceleration of \(X\) is zero at \(t = p\) and \(t = q\), where \(p < q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 166, 146, 184]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 166, 462, 184]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(p\) and the value of \(q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 166, 920, 184]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 472, 507, 492]]<|/det|>
It is given that the velocity of \(X\) is zero at \(t = 14\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 504, 146, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 504, 920, 537]]<|/det|>
Find the velocities of \(X\) at \(t = p\) and at \(t = q\), and hence sketch the velocity-time graph for the motion of \(X\) for \(0 \leqslant t \leqslant 15\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 521, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 660, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the total distance travelled by \(X\) between \(t = 0\) and \(t = 15\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 75, 568, 92]]<|/det|>
